article.title: SAIC to Support Mine Warfare Situational Awareness
article.text: Science Applications International Corp. (SAIC), McLean, Virginia, is being awarded a $9,675,674 cost-plus-fixed-fee modification to previously awarded contract N00024-14-C-6301 to exercise an option for the Mine Warfare and Environmental Decision Aids Library (MEDAL) program. The MEDAL provides mine warfare situational awareness, mission planning/evaluation and asset management software to support existing and emerging mine warfare missions, users and systems. Work will be performed in McLean and is expected to be completed by September 2017. Fiscal 2016 operation and maintenance (Navy); fiscal 2016 research, development, test and evaluation (Navy); and fiscal 2016 other procurement (Navy) in the amount of $1,088,514 will be obligated at the time of award. Funds in the amount of $463,142 will expire at the end of the fiscal year. The Naval Sea Systems Command, Washington, D.C., is the contracting activity.
